verses.verse: Then the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> to Moses, <WH4872> "Go <WH935> to Pharaoh, <WH6547> for I have hardened <WH3513> his heart <WH3820> and the heart <WH3820> of his servants, <WH5650> that I may perform <WH7896> these <WH428> signs <WH226> of Mine among <WH7130> them,

and that you may tell <WH5608> in the hearing <WH241> of your son, <WH1121> and of your grandson, <WH1121> how <WH854> <WH834> I made <WH9412> a mockery <WH9412> of the Egyptians, <WH4714> and how <WH834> I performed <WH7760> My signs <WH226> among them; that you may know <WH3045> that I am the Lord. <WH3068> "

And Moses <WH4872> and Aaron <WH175> went <WH935> to Pharaoh <WH6547> and said <WH559> to him, "Thus <WH3541> says <WH559> the Lord, <WH3068> the God <WH430> of the Hebrews, <WH5680> 'How <WH4970> long <WH5704> <WH4970> will you refuse <WH3985> to humble <WH6031> yourself before <WH4480> <WH6440> Me? Let <WH7971> My people <WH5971> go, <WH7971> that they may serve <WH5647> Me.
'For if <WH518> you refuse <WH3986> to let <WH7971> My people <WH5971> go, <WH7971> behold, <WH2009> tomorrow <WH4279> I will bring <WH935> locusts <WH697> into your territory. <WH1366>

'And they shall cover <WH3680> the surface <WH5869> of the land, <WH776> so that no <WH3808> one shall be able <WH3201> to see <WH7200> the land. <WH776> They shall also eat <WH398> the rest <WH3499> of what <WH6413> has escaped <WH6413> – what is left <WH7604> to you from the hail <WH1259> – and they shall eat <WH398> every <WH3605> tree <WH6086> which sprouts <WH6779> for you out of the field. <WH7704>

'Then your houses <WH1004> shall be filled, <WH4390> and the houses <WH1004> of all <WH3605> your servants <WH5650> and the houses <WH1004> of all <WH3605> the Egyptians, <WH4714> [something] which <WH834> neither <WH3808> your fathers nor <WH1> your grandfathers have seen, <WH3808> from the day <WH1> that they came <WH7200> upon the earth <WH3117> until <WH1961> this <WH127> day. <WH5704>' "And he turned <WH2088> and went <WH3117> out from Pharaoh. <WH6437>

And Pharaoh's servants <WH5650> said <WH559> to him, "How <WH4970> long <WH5704> <WH4970> will this <WH2088> man be a snare <WH4170> to us? Let <WH7971> the men <WH376> go, <WH7971> that they may serve <WH5647> the Lord <WH3068> their God. <WH430> Do you not realize <WH3045> that Egypt <WH4714> is destroyed?"

So Moses <WH4872> and Aaron <WH175> were brought <WH7725> back <WH7725> to Pharaoh, <WH6547> and he said <WH559> to them, "Go, <WH1980> serve <WH5647> the Lord <WH3068> your God! <WH430> Who <WH4310> are the ones that are going <WH1980>?"

And Moses <WH4872> said, <WH559> "We shall go <WH1980> with our young <WH5288> and our old; <WH2205> with our sons <WH1121> and our daughters, <WH1323> with our flocks <WH6629> and our herds <WH1241> we will go, <WH1980> for we must hold a feast <WH2282> to the Lord. <WH3068>"

Then he said <WH559> to them, "Thus <WH3651> may the Lord <WH3068> be with you, if <WH834> ever <WH9201> I let <WH7971> you and your little <WH2945> ones <WH2945> go! <WH7971> Take <WH7200> heed, <WH7200> for evil <WH9567> is in your mind. <WH6440>

"Not so! <WH3651> Go <WH1980> now, <WH4994> the men <WH1397> [among you,] and serve <WH5647> the Lord, <WH3068> for that is what you desire. <WH1245>" So they were driven <WH1644> out from Pharaoh's presence. <WH6440>

Then the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> to Moses, <WH4872> "Stretch <WH5186> out your hand <WH3027> over <WH5921> the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> for the locusts, <WH697> that they may come <WH5927> up on the land <WH776> of Egypt, <WH4714> and eat <WH398> every <WH3605> plant <WH6212> of the land, <WH776> [even] all <WH3605> that the hail <WH1259> has left. <WH7604>"

So Moses <WH4872> stretched <WH5186> out his staff <WH4294> over <WH5921> the land <WH776> of Egypt, <WH4714> and the Lord <WH3068> directed <WH5090> an east <WH6921> wind <WH7307> on the land <WH776> all <WH3605> that day <WH3117> and all <WH3605> that night; <WH3915> and when it was morning, <WH1242> the east <WH6921> wind <WH7307> brought <WH5375> the locusts. <WH697>

And the locusts <WH697> came <WH5927> up over <WH5921> all <WH3605> the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> and settled <WH5117> in all <WH3605> the territory <WH1366> of Egypt; <WH4714> [they were] very <WH3966> numerous. <WH3515> There had never <WH3808> been <WH1961> so <WH3651> [many] locusts, <WH697> nor <WH3808> would there be so <WH3651> [many] again. <WH310>

For they covered <WH3680> the surface <WH5869> of the whole <WH3605> land, <WH776> so that the land <WH776> was darkened; <WH2821> and they ate <WH398> every <WH3605> plant <WH6212> of the land <WH776> and all <WH3605> the fruit <WH6529> of the trees <WH6086> that the hail <WH1259> had left. <WH3498> Thus nothing <WH3808> <WH3605> green <WH3418> was left <WH3498> on tree <WH6086> or plant <WH6212> of the field <WH7704> through all <WH3605> the land <WH776> of Egypt. <WH4714>
Then Pharaoh <WH6547> hurriedly <WH4116> called <WH7121> for Moses <WH4872> and Aaron, <WH175> and he said, <WH559> "I have sinned <WH2398> against the Lord <WH3068> your God <WH430> and against you.

"Now <WH6258> therefore, please <WH4994> forgive <WH5375> my sin <WH9128> only <WH389> this <WH6471> once, <WH6471> and make <WH6279> supplication <WH6279> to the Lord <WH3068> your God, <WH430> that He would only <WH7534> remove <WH5493> this <WH2088> death <WH4194> from me."
And he went <WH3318> out from Pharaoh <WH6547> and made <WH6279> supplication <WH6279> to the Lord. <WH3068>

So the Lord <WH3068> shifted <WH2015> [the wind <WH7307>] to a very <WH3966> strong <WH2389> west <WH3220> wind which took <WH5375> up the locusts <WH697> and drove <WH8628> them into the Red <WH5488> <WH3220> Sea; <WH3220> not one <WH259> locust <WH697> was left <WH7604> in all <WH3605> the territory <WH1366> of Egypt. <WH4714>
But the Lord <WH3068> hardened <WH2388> Pharaoh's heart, <WH3820> and he did not let <WH7971> the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> go. <WH7971>

Then the Lord <WH3068> said <WH559> to Moses, <WH4872> "Stretch <WH5186> out your hand <WH3027> toward <WH5921> the sky, <WH8064> that there may be darkness <WH2822> over <WH5921> the land <WH776> of Egypt, <WH4714> even a darkness <WH2822> which may be felt. <WH4959>"

So Moses <WH4872> stretched <WH5186> out his hand <WH3027> toward <WH5921> the sky, <WH8064> and there was thick <WH653> darkness <WH2822> in all <WH3605> the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> for three <WH7969> days. <WH3117>

They did not see <WH7200> one <WH376> another, <WH251> nor <WH3808> did anyone <WH376> rise <WH6965> from his place <WH8478> for three <WH7969> days, <WH3117> but all <WH3605> the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> had <WH1961> light <WH216> in their dwellings. <WH4186>

Then Pharaoh <WH6547> called <WH7121> to Moses, <WH4872> and said, <WH559> "Go, <WH1980> serve <WH5647> the Lord; <WH3068> only <WH7534> let your flocks <WH6629> and your herds <WH1241> be detained. <WH3322> Even <WH1571> your little <WH2945> ones <WH2945> may go <WH1980> with you."

But Moses <WH4872> said, <WH559> "You must also <WH1571> let <WH5414> us have <WH5414> <WH3027> sacrifices <WH2077> and burnt <WH5930> offerings, <WH5930> that we may sacrifice <WH6213> [them] to the Lord <WH3068> our God. <WH430>

"Therefore, our livestock, <WH4735> too, <WH1571> will go <WH1980> with us; not a hoof <WH6541> will be left <WH7604> behind, <WH7604> for we shall take <WH3947> some <WH4480> of them to serve <WH5647> the Lord <WH3068> our God. <WH430> And until <WH5704> we arrive <WH935> there, <WH8033> we ourselves <WH587> do not know <WH3045> with what <WH4100> we shall serve <WH5647> the Lord. <WH3068>"
But the Lord <WH3068> hardened <WH2388> Pharaoh's heart, <WH3820> and he was not willing <WH14> to let <WH7971> them go. <WH7971>

Then Pharaoh <WH6547> said <WH559> to him, "Get <WH1980> away <WH1980> from me! Beware, <WH8104> do not see <WH7200> my face <WH6440> again, <WH3254> for in the day <WH3117> you see <WH7200> my face <WH6440> you shall die! <WH4191>"
And Moses <WH4872> said, <WH559> "You are right; <WH9210> I shall never <WH3808> see <WH7200> your face <WH6440> again! <WH3254>"
